intro: Micromeria biflora var. rodriguezii, commonly known as Rodriguez's narrowleaf micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and crevices. Its botanical features include glandular hairs on the stems and leaves, which may aid in reducing water loss. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar structural and chemical characteristics.
